seasoned adjective
(FOOD)
Seasoned food has had salt, pepper, herbs, or spices added to it: Some people find that highly seasoned foods or raw fruits and vegetables make their symptoms worse. If you like mildly seasoned food then you will like this recipe. Opposite
unseasoned
More examplesFewer examplesKebabs are a simple grilled meal that consists of alternating seasoned meat and vegetables on a wooden skewer.For jerky, hang seasoned meat strips in the oven and dry overnight at 175 degrees.The food was barely seasoned and was very bland.

seasoned adjective
(WOOD)
Seasoned wood has been left to dry before being used: Seasoned wood, or wood that has been dried naturally for about eight or nine months, is in short supply. Make sure you burn dry, seasoned wood that has been stored under cover for at least a year. Opposites
green (NOT READY)
unseasoned
More examplesFewer examplesDry wood or seasoned wood is difficult to find, and expensive, too, if you can find it.The door was made of tough, seasoned wood and a good inch thick.

seasoned adjective
(PAN)
A seasoned iron pan has been protected with oil before it is used: Seasoned pans should never be washed in the dishwasher. When it comes to cleaning cast iron, most manufacturers advise against the use of soap or detergent on a seasoned pan. Opposite
unseasoned
